intro: Brachystelma tenellum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are small, fleshy, and often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Brachystelma tenellum produces bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer.
